proposals.reasoning: Table sentiment strongly favored sending Charlie first for a baseline, and pairing them with Bob keeps early influence spread out without doubling down on Alice’s initial read or immediately locking in Diana. This also avoids the very quiet Bob+Eve combo that some people wanted to skip on the first mission.

votes.comment: I wanted Charlie on the first team and was mainly against a super-quiet Bob+Eve opener; Charlie+Bob fits the table’s sentiment and should give decent early info without overcommitting to my read.
I’m on it and don’t have a strong reason to distrust Charlie yet; good early info with minimal downside.
I’m fine going and don’t see Bob as suspicious enough yet to justify re-rolling the very first team; this should give us a clean early baseline.
Not my ideal pairing, but it gets Charlie out with a relatively neutral partner and keeps early influence spread out without locking anyone in too hard yet.
This matches what I asked for earlier—Charlie goes, and pairing with Bob keeps early influence spread out without over-committing to Alice’s initial read.

discussion.content: I’d really like to see Charlie on the first team; if you’re unsure who to pair with them, I’m happy to go or we can pick whoever gets the least pushback. I’d just avoid starting with a super-quiet combo like Bob + Eve right away.

I’m good with Charlie going, but I’d actually prefer pairing them with someone a bit more neutral like Diana rather than you, Alice, so we’re not locking in too hard on your early read. That gives us cleaner info if something weird happens.

I’m fine going with Diana first; from my side that keeps early influence a bit more spread out instead of doubling down on Alice right away. If people really dislike that, I’d still rather see me + Alice than a Bob + Eve opener.

I’m happy to go with Charlie first; I like that it keeps early influence spread out instead of doubling down on Alice’s read. If people feel weird about that, I’m also fine with Charlie + Alice and we can sort their alignments out from how they play it.
If we’re mostly set on Charlie going, I’d slightly rather see Charlie + Bob than Charlie + Diana so we’re not just locking in too hard on Alice’s first instinct right away.

proposals.reasoning: Bob and Charlie come from a 0-fail mission and are the most natural core to reuse, even if we shouldn’t treat them as 100% cleared yet. The table discussion showed broad comfort with adding me as the third (Bob explicitly suggested testing me; Charlie and Diana said they were fine with that option), so this lineup should get strong approval while giving us new information compared to Mission 1 without immediately anointing any non-tested player as an automatic anchor.

votes.comment: Reusing Bob and Charlie from a clean first mission makes sense, and the table was broadly comfortable testing me as the third here.
Reuses the successful Bob/Charlie core and tests Alice as a new third; nothing in discussion makes this lineup riskier than alternatives, and it gives useful info if it fails.
Reusing the 0-fail Bob/Charlie core plus one new player is a solid Mission 2 structure, and I don’t currently see Alice as more suspicious than Diana or Eve, so I’m fine testing her here.
Bob/Charlie from a clean mission plus Alice was already discussed as a reasonable variant; I slightly preferred me as the third but I’m fine testing Alice here.
Bob/Charlie from a 0-fail mission is a solid core; I slightly preferred a version with me but I’m fine testing Alice here.

discussion.content: I’d like to reuse Bob and Charlie from the first mission and just debate the third slot—personally I’m happy with Bob/Charlie/me as a starting point. That said, we shouldn’t treat the first team as 100% cleared yet since evil can always choose to pass early.

Reusing me and Charlie makes sense to me, but I agree we shouldn’t treat that as a guaranteed clean pair yet. Between you, Eve, and Diana as the third slot, I’m okay testing you this mission to get some fresh info.

I’m happy to reuse Bob and me, but I’d actually rather add Diana as the third so we get info on someone new instead of locking in an Alice-centered trio this early. If people strongly prefer Alice I won’t fight it too hard, but I don’t see her as strictly better than testing Diana/Eve here.

Reusing Bob and Charlie works for me, and I slightly prefer adding me over Alice just to avoid locking in an Alice-centered core this early. That said, I’m fine with either option if the table is more comfortable one way or the other.

Reusing Bob and Charlie sounds good to me, but between the options I’d slightly lean toward adding me this round—Bob/Charlie/Eve gives us new info without immediately turning Alice into the default anchor for every team.

proposals.reasoning: I trust myself as good, and pairing myself with Diana keeps both Alice and Charlie, the only players who could have caused the fail on mission 2 from my perspective, off this critical 2-person team. Among the remaining players, Diana feels slightly safer than Eve and is also acceptable to several others based on their stated preferences, so Bob + Diana maximizes our chance of a clean mission while still being likely to get approved.

votes.comment: This matches what I argued for earlier: only one of {Alice, Bob, Charlie} plus new Diana, keeping the main suspects split while we test Diana on a small team.

I know I’m good, and this team keeps both Alice and Charlie (the only possible sources of the last fail) off. Diana and Eve are equally likely to be good from my view, so Bob+Diana is about as safe a 2-person team as we can get.
I know I’m good and the fail on mission 2 had to be from Alice or Bob, so keeping Bob on this 2‑person team while excluding me is unnecessarily risky compared to a team like me + Diana or me + Eve.
This matches what I suggested earlier: test Bob with me while keeping Alice off right after the failed mission.
I still don’t like putting completely untested Diana on such a crucial 2‑person mission; I’d rather see a team like Bob+me or Charlie+me instead.

discussion.content: I know I look bad since I was the only new person on the failed mission, but that also gave Bob and Charlie perfect cover if one of them is the spy. For this 2‑person team I’d rather see at most one of us three, paired with someone new like Diana to get more info.

From my perspective at least one of you or Charlie has to be evil, so we really shouldn’t put both of you on a team again. I’d be happiest with a two‑person team of me and Diana (or me and Eve) this round.

Since I know I played success both times, the fail on mission 2 had to come from either Alice or Bob from my point of view. For this 2‑person team I’d most trust something like me and Diana (or me and Eve) and leave both Alice and Bob off for now.

Given the fail had to come from somewhere in {Alice, Bob, Charlie}, I’d rather keep Alice off for now and do a two‑person team of either Bob + me or Charlie + me so we get a clearer read on at least one of them.

I’m pretty wary of putting Alice straight back on after that fail. For a 2‑person team I’d lean toward Bob + me or Charlie + me rather than pairing either of them with totally untested Diana on such a swingy mission.

proposals.reasoning: Mission 2’s single fail had to come from Alice or Bob, since I know I played success. Mission 3 was a clean two‑person mission with Bob and Diana, which makes that pair look substantially better than Alice, who is the only guaranteed common factor on the failed mission, and Eve, whose argument selectively discounts the Bob/Diana success while leaning hard on Mission 1 in a way that feels agenda‑driven. The most consistent story with the mission results and the table talk is that the two evils are likely among Alice and Eve, so I want to keep both of them off this critical mission and go with myself plus the two players with the strongest on‑board track record: Bob and Diana.

votes.comment: This is exactly the Bob/Charlie/Diana team I advocated earlier and it keeps me, the only common factor on the failed mission, off the board.
Mission 2’s fail had to be Alice or Charlie, and nothing since has cleared Charlie for me. I’d much rather send myself with Diana and Eve than bring Charlie back onto this critical mission.
From my seat the Mission 2 fail is still most likely on Alice or Bob, and this team unnecessarily brings Bob back in instead of trying the cleaner-looking Charlie/Diana/Eve trio.
Keeps Alice off and uses the two players with the strongest mission track record so far.
Too much weight on the single Bob/Diana success for me; I still don’t fully trust Diana and would rather build around the earlier clean Bob/Charlie pair with me added.

proposals.reasoning: Bob and I just had a clean two-person Mission 3, so I want to keep that trusted pair together. The only failure so far was the Alice/Bob/Charlie team, and across everyone’s reads Alice is the most suspicious from that lineup, so I’m keeping her off this mission. Between Charlie and Eve for the third spot, Charlie is still tied to that failed mission while Eve hasn’t been tested at all yet, so adding Eve both avoids recycling the Mission 2 tangle and finally gives us information on her. Overall, Diana/Bob/Eve looks like the safest and most informative team.

votes.comment: Keeps me off after the Mission 2 fail, keeps the trusted Bob/Diana pair from Mission 3, and finally gives us a read on Eve.
Keeps both Mission 2 suspects (Alice and Charlie) off while keeping my clean pair with Diana and finally testing Eve; this looks like the safest team.

Given Mission 2’s fail and that I know I’m good, every remaining plausible evil pair puts at least one evil on {Bob, Diana, Eve}, so this team is guaranteed to include an evil; I’d rather push for a lineup like me/Diana/Eve instead.
It keeps Alice off the team, preserves the previously clean Bob/Diana pair, and finally gives us a read on Eve.
Still not comfortable treating the Bob+Diana pair as cleared from one success; I’d rather build from the Mission 1 Bob+Charlie team instead.

discussion.content: Bob feels the safest and Diana looks pretty good after that clean two-person mission, so I’d like to see a team like Bob/Charlie/Diana while I sit this one out since the only fail we’ve had was the one I was on.

I’m happy to stick with me and Diana after that clean two-person mission, but since I know I’m good the fail on Mission 2 had to be Alice or Charlie, so I’d much rather see a team of me/Diana/Eve than bring Charlie back in.
Since I know I’m good, that Mission 2 fail had to come from either Alice or Bob, so I don’t want either of them on this one. I’d rather we go with me, Diana, and Eve.

Given Bob and Charlie are cross-accusing, the one clear common factor in the failed Mission 2 is Alice, so I’d really like to keep her off this one and finally get Eve involved. Between Bob and Charlie I lean a bit toward Bob after our clean two‑person mission, so my ideal is me, Bob, and Eve.

From my seat, the clean Bob/Charlie Mission 1 is still the strongest thing we’ve seen, so I’d most like to send Bob and Charlie with me this time. I’m a bit wary of leaning too hard on that single Bob/Diana success, since an evil could easily have passed there.

proposals.reasoning: Charlie feels like the safest anchor after the clean first mission, and I really do not want to lock Bob and Diana together again after Diana’s team with Bob on mission 4 produced the second fail. Between Alice pushing a Bob-less team that still includes Diana and others pushing to put Diana back on again, the lowest-risk compromise to me is Bob, Charlie, and myself, keeping both Alice and Diana off this last mission.

votes.comment: Bob’s still the only player on both failed missions; I’d rather send a team that leaves him off.
Eve is still too likely to be evil from the mission-fail pattern; I trust the Charlie–Bob–Diana team more than this one.
Mission patterns and who has (not) been on successes make Alice and Eve the likeliest evil pair, so putting Eve on this final team is too risky; I only trust a Bob–Charlie–Diana team here.
This lineup still includes Eve, and from the mission results I still think Alice/Eve is the most likely evil pair, so I prefer the Charlie-Bob-me team instead.
This keeps both Alice and Diana off the mission, keeps Charlie from the clean first mission on, and avoids repeating the Bob–Diana combo that just failed.

proposals.reasoning: I’m keeping Bob off because he’s the only player who appears on both failed missions (2 and 4), which I just can’t ignore, even if others are leaning on the ‘no spy ever passed’ assumption to clear him. From my point of view, that makes Bob the likeliest spy, paired with one of Charlie/Diana/Eve. If Bob is almost certainly one of the two evils and I know I’m good, then among Charlie, Diana, and Eve there can be at most one spy, so sending all three of them while leaving Bob out is the best compromise I see. I’m also deliberately leaving myself off since some of you clearly distrust me; this way the team doesn’t depend on you believing in my alignment, only on removing the common factor from the failed quests.

votes.comment: This keeps Bob—the only player on both failed missions—off the team and matches the logic I’ve been pushing; with me sitting out, Charlie/Diana/Eve looks like the safest compromise.
Rejecting; given the previous mission results, every spy pairing consistent with the game puts at least one spy on the Charlie–Diana–Eve team, so this cannot be a safe final mission.
Too likely Diana is a spy given the mission 4 fail and how proposal 1 was voted down; I don’t want her on the final team.

Bob being the only one on both failed missions is too big to ignore, and with Alice leaving herself off, Charlie–Diana–Eve looks like the lowest-risk compromise even if I drop the ‘no spy ever passed’ assumption.
This still keeps Diana from the last failed mission on the team while dropping Bob entirely; I’d rather swap Diana for Bob than double down on that lineup.

proposals.reasoning: As Bob I know I am good, and both failed missions (2 and 4) had exactly one FAIL card while I was on them, so each of those teams must have had exactly one spy among my teammates. That means one spy is in {Alice, Charlie} and the other is in {Diana, Eve}. Any team containing both Diana and Eve (like Alice’s suggested Charlie–Diana–Eve) is therefore guaranteed to include at least one spy, so calling that the 'safest' combo makes Alice look very suspicious. Eve was on the most recent failed mission with me and Diana and is now pushing hard to get back onto the final team, which also fits her being the other spy. The only pairing of spies that explains the mission record without ever requiring a spy to have passed on a mission is Alice and Eve as the evil pair; in that case Bob, Charlie, and Diana are all good. That makes Bob–Charlie–Diana the unique trio that can be entirely good and thus the safest final team to propose.

votes.comment: Still uneasy about Bob, but with time running out this B/C/D team feels like the least-bad option to get a mission off the ground.
Given the mission results and knowing I’m good, Bob–Charlie–Diana is the most likely all-good team and the only trio that fits the pattern without requiring a spy to have passed earlier.
Most consistent explanation of the mission record is Alice/Eve as the spy pair; team B–C–D keeps both of them off and is the highest-probability all-good team.
Bob–Charlie–Diana is the only team that fits all mission results without needing any spy to have passed earlier, so it still looks like the safest trio.
I still don’t trust Diana after the Bob–Diana pair first passed then later failed; I don’t want to risk her on the final team.

discussion.content: Given that Bob’s the only one on both failed missions, I really think Charlie should build a team without him—Charlie, Diana, and Eve feels like the safest combo to me right now.

Charlie, if you walk through the fail patterns, Alice’s Charlie–Diana–Eve team is actually guaranteed to contain at least one spy, which makes her look really suspicious to me. The team that fits the missions without needing an evil to have passed earlier is you, me, and Diana—Charlie, Bob, and Diana.
Looking at which missions could have had zero spies, the pattern makes Alice and Eve look like the likeliest pair of evils, so the team I trust most for this last run is me, Bob, and Diana.

From the missions so far, the only way we don’t have to assume a spy ever passed is if Alice and Eve are the pair, which makes Charlie/Bob/me look like the safest trio. I hate leaving Eve off again, but I’d rather go with the low-assumption team here.

Charlie, C/B/D scares me because it locks Bob and Diana together again, and the one time Diana actually led a team with Bob on it we got a fail; if you trust yourself most here, I think the safer gamble is you, Bob, and me.
